son of Amandil. He reigned titularly as High King of the Dúnedain from  – .  His sons Isildur and Anárion were the co-rulers of Gondor itself (until Anárions death in )

column1: # Meneldil fourth child and son of Anárion reigned Third Age 2 – 158
# Tarannon Falastur r. 840 – 913. First of the Ship-Kings
# Eärnil I r. 913 – 936. Nephew of Tarannon
# Hyarmendacil I (born Ciryaher) r. 1015 – 1149. Last of the Ship-Kings
# Narmacil I r. 1226 – 1294. Second childless King
# Calmacil (King of Gondor) r. 1294 – 1304. Younger brother of Narmacil*Minalcar

column2: crowned as Eldacar (King of Gondor) reigned 1432 – 1437

column1: # Castamir usurped the throne during the Kin-strife in 1437
# Telemnar r. 1634 – 1636. Died in the Great Plague with all his children.
# Tarondor (King of Gondor) r. 1636 – 1798. Nephew of Telemnar
# Ondoher r. 1936 – 1944. Died in battle with his two sons*Fíriel daughter of Ondoher might have been ruling Queen
# Eärnil II r. 1945 – 2043. Was given the crown after a year of rule by the Stewards of Gondor Pelendur. A descendant of Telumehtar Umbardacil
# Eärnur r. 2043 – c. 2050. Last King of Gondor before the Reign of the Stewards. Was probably murdered by the Witch-king.

column2: was the first high king of the Reunited Kingdom

column1: Elendil was the first King of Arnor and was succeeded by Isildur.  Elendil ruled over both realms as High King of the Dúnedain-in-exile Isildur succeeded as High King as well upon his fathers death.  Isildur committed Gondor to the rule of Meneldil the son of Anarion as sole King of Gondor
column2: but Isildurs royalty in the South-realm remained
column3: as his line was by right High King over both Arnor and Gondor
column5: the realms were split. Isildurs heirs ruled Arnor and Anárions heirs ruled Gondor.

column1: Eärnur was taken in Minas Morgul and never seen again
column2: and the Kingdom of Gondor was ruled by a succession of Stewards of Gondor until the restoration of the line of Kings with Elessar (Aragorn)
column3: the first king of the Reunited Kingdom of Gondor and Arnor.
